    Category
    Unicode categories constructed from tightly compressed string and array literals instead of large resources.
    ChanceSubstitution
    An implementation of the Substitution interface that allows a pseudo-random chance to determine whether a replacement should actually be performed.

    Pattern
    A handle for a precompiled regular expression; core operations should be identical to java.util.regex.Pattern .
    PatternSyntaxException
    Is thrown when Pattern constructor's argument doesn't conform the Perl5 regular expression syntax.
    PerlSubstitution
    An implementation of the Substitution interface.
    REFlags
     
    Replacer
    The Replacer class suggests some methods to replace occurrences of a pattern either by a result of evaluation of a perl-like expression, or by a plain string, or according to a custom substitution model, provided as a Substitution interface implementation.
    A Replacer instance may be obtained either using Pattern.replacer(...) method, or by constructor: Pattern p=new Pattern("\\w+"); Replacer perlExpressionReplacer=p.replacer("[$&]"); //or another way to do the same Substitution myOwnModel=new Substitution(){ public void appendSubstitution(MatchResult match,TextBuffer tb){ tb.append('['); match.getGroup(MatchResult.MATCH,tb); tb.append(']'); } } Replacer myVeryOwnReplacer=new Replacer(p,myOwnModel); The second method is much more verbose, but gives more freedom.
    Replacer.StringBufferBuffer
     
    Replacer.StringBuilderBuffer
     
    RETokenizer
    The Tokenizer class suggests a methods to break a text into tokens using occurrences of a pattern as delimiters.
